title: Scotland facing probe over 'disappointing' Japan comments
text:
World Rugby have referred the Scottish Rugby Union to an Independent Disputes Committee in the wake of comments made by SRU chief executive Mark Dodson.

Dodson revealed last week that the SRU was considering legal action when it looked as if the country’s final World Cup pool game against Japan last Sunday might be called off due to Typhoon Hagibis. Such a scenario might have seen Scotland exit the tournament without getting the chance to fight to stay in it.

In particular, comments Dodson made on Radio 4 are thought to be under scrutiny with the SRU chief claiming that World Rugby had taken a decision to cancel rather than reschedule the game, if the weather was too bad, “in haste”.
